name: Version Control
description: Here at L2C we use Git and GitHub for our version control. I need you to spend a few days getting up to speed with them.

learning_steps.text: Star the Learn to Cloud Repository
learning_steps.title: Learn to Cloud Repository

learning_steps.text: Set up an AI learning assistant
learning_steps.action: Set up an AI learning assistant
learning_steps.description: Here at L2C we are big fans of GenAI abilities to help with learning. We leverage it a lot to dive deeper and clarify concepts. It's a good time for you to setup an account with any tool you'd like and start using it for your own learning. Try it out first with testing your knowledge on what version control is. Use this prompt as a template:
learning_steps.code: I'm studying cloud engineering and recently learned about version control. I will provide you an explanation about it and please ask me any questions if my explanation is not clear. I want to make sure I really understand this concept so please do not correct me, simply ask questions until I get the explanation right. Here is my explanation: version control is...

learning_steps.text: Install VS Code - We use VS Code for all our programming
learning_steps.title: VS Code
learning_steps.description: We use VS Code for all our programming

learning_steps.text: Windows users only: Set up WSL
learning_steps.title: Set up WSL
learning_steps.description: All our labs and tools expect a Linux based environment, WSL will provide that. Then follow:

secondary_links.text: Get started using Visual Studio Code with Windows Subsystem for Linux

learning_steps.title: Command Line for Beginners – How to Use the Terminal Like a Pro

learning_steps.description: Using a Terminal, create a folder on your computer where you will store all your labs and projects. Name it `l2c`. Use the `mkdir` and `cd` commands for this.

Clone your README repo to your local machine. Use VS Code to edit it and push changes back to GitHub from the terminal. Don't feel like you have to make a very fancy README—write a brief description on who you are and add links to your socials.

secondary_links.text: Great guide on using markdown with VS Code

test_knowledge_prompts: Can you ask me what version control is and why it's important?
Can you quiz me on the basic Git commands like clone, commit, push, and pull?
Can you ask me what a repository is and how Git tracks changes?

checklist.text: I understand what version control is
I know what a git repository is
I know how to clone a repository
Git is installed on my computer
VS Code is installed on my computer
I created the l2c folder using mkdir
The lab repo is cloned locally
My README repo is cloned locally
I starred the Learn to Cloud repository
